de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.datasource.filter.normalization.columnwise

Class AttributeWiseMADNormalization<V extends NumberVector>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.datasource.filter.normalization.columnwise.AttributeWiseMADNormalization<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - vector type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Normalization<V>, ObjectFilter

    @Alias(value="de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.datasource.filter.normalization.AttributeWiseMADNormalization")
public class AttributeWiseMADNormalization<V extends NumberVector>
extends Object
implements Normalization<V>
    Median Absolute Deviation is used for scaling the data set as follows: First, the median, and median absolute deviation are computed in each axis. Then, each value is projected to (x - median(X)) / MAD(X). This is similar to z-standardization of data sets, except that it is more robust towards outliers, and only slightly more expensive to compute.
    Since:
    0.6.0
    Author:
    Erich Schubert
